trans-unit.target: Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal

trans-unit.target: [AZURE.SELECTOR]

trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore - REST API

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com).

trans-unit.source: Azure SQL Database has built-in backups to support self-service Point in Time Restore for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Azure SQL Database has built-in backups to support self-service Point in Time Restore for Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Point in Time Restore creates a new database.
trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore creates a new database.

trans-unit.source: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.
trans-unit.target: The service automatically selects the service tier based on the backup used at the restore point.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have available quota on the logical server to create another database.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact [Azure Support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).
trans-unit.target: If you'd like to request an increased quota, contact [Azure Support](http://azure.microsoft.com/support/options/).

trans-unit.source: Restrictions and Security
trans-unit.target: Restrictions and Security

trans-unit.source: Point in Time Restore is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Point in Time Restore is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.
trans-unit.target: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.

trans-unit.source: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.
trans-unit.target: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.

trans-unit.source: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.
trans-unit.target: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support Point in Time Restore.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support Point in Time Restore.

trans-unit.source: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff951631.aspx) and [How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh335292.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/ff951631.aspx) and [How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/hh335292.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn741330.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn741330.aspx).

trans-unit.source: How to: Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: How to: Restore an Azure SQL database using Point in Time Restore in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com) using your Microsoft account.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the [Azure portal](http://manage.windowsazure.com) using your Microsoft account.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation, click **SQL DATABASES**.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation, click **SQL DATABASES**.

trans-unit.source: In the **DATABASES** list, click the database you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: In the **DATABASES** list, click the database you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click **RESTORE**.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click **RESTORE**.

trans-unit.source: This launches the **Specify restore settings** dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This launches the **Specify restore settings** dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Choose a **DATABASE NAME**.
trans-unit.target: Choose a **DATABASE NAME**.

trans-unit.source: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.
trans-unit.target: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.

trans-unit.source: Choose the point in time to which your database should be restored.
trans-unit.target: Choose the point in time to which your database should be restored.

trans-unit.source: The point in time must be within the database's retention period.
trans-unit.target: The point in time must be within the database's retention period.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.

trans-unit.source: A restore may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A restore may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click **DETAILS**.
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click **DETAILS**.
